Health Risk, draft archetype, NEHTA Clinical Knowledge Manager [Internet]. Australia: National eHealth Transition Authority. Authored: 2006 Apr 23. Available at: http://dcm.nehta.org.au/ckm/#showArchetype_1013.1.1276 (accessed 2015 Mar 04). Archetype originated from the openEHR CKM.

details.purpose: Zur Dokumentation des Vorhandenseins eines Risikos mit möglichen Auswirkungen jetzt oder in der Zukunft
details.use:
*Use to record known risk factors for an identified disease, condition, or other potentially adverse health issue, and/or an evaluation of the likelihood of the individual experiencing it in the future.
As risk factors may be gradually identified over time and the overall risk reassessed as a result, the 'Date identified' will record the date on which each risk factor has been identified and the 'Last updated' data element will record the last time that the whole assessment was updated.(en)

details.purpose:
Att registrera kända riskfaktorer för en identifierad sjukdom, tillstånd eller annat potentiellt skadligt hälsotillstånd, och / eller en utvärdering av sannolikheten för att personen upplever det i framtiden.
Denna arketyp har medvetet lämnats öppen och omfattande. Risken kan bestämmas av riskfaktorer från någon eller alla följande domäner: medicinska; biomarkör; livsstil; social; yrkesrisk; eller miljödomäner.
Avsikten med denna arketyp är att dokumentera potentiell risk vid en tidpunkt och att stödja beslutsfattande som kan minska den identifierade risken, vare sig av kliniker eller individen själva.
details.use:
Används för att registrera kända riskfaktorer för en identifierad sjukdom, tillstånd eller annat potentiellt skadligt hälsotillstånd, och / eller en utvärdering av sannolikheten för att personen drabbas av det i framtiden.
Eftersom riskfaktorer kan identifieras gradvis över tiden och den övergripande risken omvärderas som ett resultat kommer den "identifierade Datum" att registrera det datum då varje riskfaktor har identifierats och "Senast uppdaterad" dataelement registrerar sista gången att hela utvärderingen uppdaterades.

details.purpose:
*To record known risk factors for, and assess the potential risk of Covid-19 infection.
The intent of this archetype is to document potential risk at a point in time, and to support decision-making that may reduce the identified risk, whether by clinicians or the individual themselves.(en)
details.use:
*To record known risk factors for, and assess the potential risk of Covid-19 infection.
As risk factors may be gradually identified over time and the overall risk reassessed as a result, the 'Date identified' will record the date on which each risk factor has been identified and the 'Last updated' data element will record the last time that the whole assessment was updated.(en)

details.purpose: Para el registro de factores de riesgo para una enfermedad, condición u otro problema potencialmente adverso para la salud, y/o para la evaluación de la probabilidad de que el individuo experimente estas situaciones en el futuro. Este arquetipo se mantiene deliberadamente abierto y amplio en su alcance. El 'Riesgo para la Salud' puede ser determinado a partir de todos o algunos de los factores de riesgo: médicos, marcadores biológicos, estilo de vidas, sociales, riesgo ocupacional o cuestiones ambientales. El propósito de este arquetipo es la documentación de un riesgo potencial en un punto en el tiempo, y para asistir en la toma de decisiones que puedan reducir el mencionado riesgo, ya sea por parte de los médicos o del/de los individuo/s mismo/s.
details.use:
*Use to record known risk factors for an identified disease, condition, or other potentially adverse health issue, and/or an evaluation of the likelihood of the individual experiencing it in the future.
As risk factors may be gradually identified over time and the overall risk reassessed as a result, the 'Date identified' will record the date on which each risk factor has been identified and the 'Last updated' data element will record the last time that the whole assessment was updated.(en)

details.purpose:
To record known risk factors for, and assess the potential risk of Covid-19 infection.
The intent of this archetype is to document potential risk at a point in time, and to support decision-making that may reduce the identified risk, whether by clinicians or the individual themselves.
details.use:
To record known risk factors for, and assess the potential risk of Covid-19 infection.
As risk factors may be gradually identified over time and the overall risk reassessed as a result, the 'Date identified' will record the date on which each risk factor has been identified and the 'Last updated' data element will record the last time that the whole assessment was updated.

details.purpose: لتسجيل التخاطر/احتمالية الخطر لظرف صحي قد يحدث في المستقبل
details.use:
*Use to record known risk factors for an identified disease, condition, or other potentially adverse health issue, and/or an evaluation of the likelihood of the individual experiencing it in the future.
As risk factors may be gradually identified over time and the overall risk reassessed as a result, the 'Date identified' will record the date on which each risk factor has been identified and the 'Last updated' data element will record the last time that the whole assessment was updated.(en)

details.purpose:
Registrare i fattori di rischio noti e valutare il rischio potenziale di infezione da Covid-19.
L'intento di questo archetipo è quello di documentare il rischio potenziale in un determinato momento e di supportare le decisioni che possono ridurre il rischio identificato, sia da parte dei clinici che dell'individuo stesso.
details.keywords: valutazione, rischio, giudizio, valutazione, avverso, fattore, salute, problema, stima, gestione, fattore di rischio, stratificazione del rischio
details.use:
Registrare i fattori di rischio noti e valutare il rischio potenziale di infezione da Covid-19.
Poiché i fattori di rischio possono essere identificati gradualmente nel tempo e il rischio complessivo può essere rivalutato di conseguenza, la "Data identificata" registrerà la data in cui ciascun fattore di rischio è stato identificato e l'elemento di dati "Ultimo aggiornamento" registrerà l'ultima volta che l'intera valutazione è stata aggiornata.

items.items: *Assessment of the potential and likelihood of future adverse health effects as determined by identified risk factors.(en)
*Identification of the potential future disease, condition or health issue for which the risk is being assessed, by name.(en)

*Coding of 'Health risk' with a terminology is preferred, where possible. Free text should be used only if there is no appropriate terminology available. For example: risk of cardiovascular disease, with risk factors of hypertension and hypercholesterolaemia.(en)
*Identification of the risk factor, by name.(en)

*For example: hypertension and hypercholesterolaemia, which may be used as part of the overall assessment for cardiovascular disease; or a genetic marker. Coding of 'Risk factor' with a terminology, where possible.(en)
*Contact with suspected case/ pneumonia case within 14 days before symptom onset. (en)
*Contact with birds in China in 10 days before symptom onset. (en)
*Contact with confirmed human case of Avian flu in China (en)
*Contact with confirmed human case of Avian flu in China in 10 days before symptom onset. (en)
*Contact with severe, unexplained respiratory disease in 10 days before symptom onset. (en)
*Structured detail about other aspects of the risk factor assessment.(en)
*For example: Prevalence of the risk factor in family members.(en)
*No information is available for this risk factor. (en)

*There may be multiple variations on the assessment of risk. The Choice data type allows for recording of the assessment as either free text or value sets (such as low, medium or hig). The proportion data type allows recording of a percentage, a ratio or a fraction. The quantity data type allows recording of a decimal number.(en)
*Covid19 infection is assessed to be low-risk (en)
*The risk of the a patient having a Covid-19 infection is assessed to be high. (en)
*Does the patient require hospital admission with either clinical or radiological evidence of pneumonia, adult respiratory distress syndrome, or influenza like illness? (en)
*Assessment of the potential and likelihood of future adverse health effects as determined by identified risk factors.(en)
*Identification of the potential future disease, condition or health issue for which the risk is being assessed, by name.(en)

*Coding of 'Health risk' with a terminology is preferred, where possible. Free text should be used only if there is no appropriate terminology available. For example: risk of cardiovascular disease, with risk factors of hypertension and hypercholesterolaemia.(en)

*There may be multiple variations on the assessment of risk. The Choice data type allows for recording of the assessment as either free text or value sets (such as low, medium or hig). The proportion data type allows recording of a percentage, a ratio or a fraction. The quantity data type allows recording of a decimal number.(en)
*Details that may be added to this data element may include information about the population subgroups etc against which the determination of risk is assessed.(en)
*Additional information required to capture local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms.(en)
*For example: local information requirements or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.(en)
*Identification of the path to the archetype or data node for the evidence of risk.(en)
*Identification of the risk factor, by name.(en)

*For example: hypertension and hypercholesterolaemia, which may be used as part of the overall assessment for cardiovascular disease; or a genetic marker. Coding of 'Risk factor' with a terminology, where possible.(en)
*Additional narrative about the risk assessment not captured in other fields.(en)
*The risk factor has been identified for this individual.(en)
*The risk factor has not been identified for this individual.(en)
*Record of whether the risk assessment is a relative or absolute.(en)
*Ratio of probability of a health event or condition occurring compared to a population with similar characteristics eg same age and sex.(en)
*Ratio of probability of a health event or condition occurring compared to the population as a whole.(en)
*The time period during which the predicted health risk is relevant.(en)
*That is: the risk of experiencing the identified 'Health risk' in the next <X> years.(en)
*The date this health risk assessment was last updated.(en)

*This data element may be thought redundant if the data is recorded and stored using COMPOSITIONs within a closed clinical system. However if this information is extracted from its original COMPOSITION context, for example, to be included in another document or message then the temporal context is effectively removed. This 'Last updated' data element has been explicitly added to allow the critical temporal data to be kept alongside the clinical data in all circumstances. It is assumed that the clinical system can copy the date from the COMPOSITION to reduce the need for duplication of data entry by the clinician. (en)
*Identification of the algorithm or guideline used to make the assessment of risk.(en)
*It is not possible to determine if the risk factor is present or absent.(en)
*Structured detail about other aspects of the risk factor assessment.(en)
*For example: Prevalence of the risk factor in family members.(en)
*The risk factor has been identified as present, but then subsequently been mitigated by treatment or investigation.(en)

*Record as True if the risk factor has been treated or investigated and risk from this risk factor is considered to be lessened. For example: an infant given gentamicin in neonatal intensive care is regarded as having a risk of permanent hearing loss. If diagnostic testing shows no evidence of hearing loss in the first year of life, the risk of later hearing loss is considered to be much reduced, but still possible. This data element allows clinicians to say that the risk has been mitigated but should still be considered as a possibility in future. In practice, the risk factor could be maintained in the risk assessment in case it might impact the individual's health at a future time, but flagging that its contribution to risk calculation may not be as great as if it had not been previously treated or investigated. (en)
*The date/time that the risk factor was identified.(en)
*Additional narrative about the risk factor not captured in other fields.(en)
*The patient is in a house with other household members who are ill (en)
*Members of the patient's household have travel exposure. (en)
*Assessment of the potential and likelihood of future adverse health effects as determined by identified risk factors.(en)
*Identification of the potential future disease, condition or health issue for which the risk is being assessed, by name.(en)

*Coding of 'Health risk' with a terminology is preferred, where possible. Free text should be used only if there is no appropriate terminology available. For example: risk of cardiovascular disease, with risk factors of hypertension and hypercholesterolaemia.(en)
*Identification of the risk factor, by name.(en)

*For example: hypertension and hypercholesterolaemia, which may be used as part of the overall assessment for cardiovascular disease; or a genetic marker. Coding of 'Risk factor' with a terminology, where possible.(en)
*Contact with suspected case/ pneumonia case within 14 days before symptom onset. (en)
*Contact with birds in China in 10 days before symptom onset. (en)
*Contact with confirmed human case of Avian flu in China (en)
*Contact with confirmed human case of Avian flu in China in 10 days before symptom onset. (en)
*Contact with severe, unexplained respiratory disease in 10 days before symptom onset. (en)
*Structured detail about other aspects of the risk factor assessment.(en)
*For example: Prevalence of the risk factor in family members.(en)
*No information is available for this risk factor. (en)

The proportion data type allows recording of a percentage, a ratio or a fraction. The quantity data type allows recording of a decimal number.(en)

The proportion data type allows recording of a percentage, a ratio or a fraction. The quantity data type allows recording of a decimal number.(en)

However if this information is extracted from its original COMPOSITION context, for example, to be included in another document or message then the temporal context is effectively removed. This 'Last updated' data element has been explicitly added to allow the critical temporal data to be kept alongside the clinical data in all circumstances. It is assumed that the clinical system can copy the date from the COMPOSITION to reduce the need for duplication of data entry by the clinician. (en)

*Structured detail about other aspects of the risk factor assessment.(en)

For example: an infant given gentamicin in neonatal intensive care is regarded as having a risk of permanent hearing loss. If diagnostic testing shows no evidence of hearing loss in the first year of life, the risk of later hearing loss is considered to be much reduced, but still possible. In practice, the risk factor could be maintained in the risk assessment in case it might impact the individual's health at a future time, but flagging that its contribution to risk calculation may not be as great as if it had not been previously treated or investigated. Assessment of the potential and likelihood of Covid-19 infection as determined by identified risk factors.
Identification of the potential future disease, condition or health issue for which the risk is being assessed, by name.

Coding of 'Health risk' with a terminology is preferred, where possible. Free text should be used only if there is no appropriate terminology available. For example: risk of cardiovascular disease, with risk factors of hypertension and hypercholesterolaemia.
Assessment of risk of COVID-19 infection.
Identification of the risk factor, by name.

For example: hypertension and hypercholesterolaemia, which may be used as part of the overall assessment for cardiovascular disease; or a genetic marker. Coding of 'Risk factor' with a terminology, where possible.
Contact with confirmed Covid-19 case within 14 days before symptom onset.
Contact with suspected case/ pneumonia case
Contact with suspected case/ pneumonia case within 14 days before symptom onset.
Contact with birds in China in 10 days before symptom onset.
Contact with confirmed human case of Avian flu in China
Contact with confirmed human case of Avian flu in China in 10 days before symptom onset.
Contact with severe, unexplained respiratory disease
Contact with severe, unexplained respiratory disease in 10 days before symptom onset.
Potential contact exposure based on location
Potential contact exposure based on location.
Structured detail about other aspects of the risk factor assessment.
For example: Prevalence of the risk factor in family members.
No information is available for this risk factor.

There may be multiple variations on the assessment of risk. The Choice data type allows for recording of the assessment as either free text or value sets (such as low, medium or hig). The proportion data type allows recording of a percentage, a ratio or a fraction. The quantity data type allows recording of a decimal number.
The risk of the a patient having a Covid-19 infection is assessed to be low.
The risk of the a patient having a Covid-19 infection is assessed to be high.
Does the patient require hospital admission with either clinical or radiological evidence of pneumonia, adult respiratory distress syndrome, or influenza like illness?
Assessment of the potential and likelihood of future adverse health effects as determined by identified risk factors.
Identification of the potential future disease, condition or health issue for which the risk is being assessed, by name.

Coding of 'Health risk' with a terminology is preferred, where possible. Free text should be used only if there is no appropriate terminology available. For example: risk of cardiovascular disease, with risk factors of hypertension and hypercholesterolaemia.

There may be multiple variations on the assessment of risk. The Choice data type allows for recording of the assessment as either free text or value sets (such as low, medium or hig). The proportion data type allows recording of a percentage, a ratio or a fraction. The quantity data type allows recording of a decimal number.
Details that may be added to this data element may include information about the population subgroups etc against which the determination of risk is assessed.
Additional information required to capture local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms.
For example: local information requirements or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.
Identification of the path to the archetype or data node for the evidence of risk.
Identification of the risk factor, by name.

For example: hypertension and hypercholesterolaemia, which may be used as part of the overall assessment for cardiovascular disease; or a genetic marker. Coding of 'Risk factor' with a terminology, where possible.
Narrative description about the risk factor.
Additional narrative about the risk assessment not captured in other fields.
Details about each possible risk factor.
The risk factor has been identified for this individual.
The risk factor has not been identified for this individual.
Record of whether the risk assessment is a relative or absolute.
Ratio of probability of a health event or condition occurring compared to a population with similar characteristics eg same age and sex.
Ratio of probability of a health event or condition occurring compared to the population as a whole.
The time period during which the predicted health risk is relevant.
That is: the risk of experiencing the identified 'Health risk' in the next <X> years.
The date this health risk assessment was last updated.

This data element may be thought redundant if the data is recorded and stored using COMPOSITIONs within a closed clinical system. However if this information is extracted from its original COMPOSITION context, for example, to be included in another document or message then the temporal context is effectively removed. This 'Last updated' data element has been explicitly added to allow the critical temporal data to be kept alongside the clinical data in all circumstances. It is assumed that the clinical system can copy the date from the COMPOSITION to reduce the need for duplication of data entry by the clinician.
Identification of the algorithm or guideline used to make the assessment of risk.
For example: Framingham cardiovascular risk calculator.
It is not possible to determine if the risk factor is present or absent.
Structured detail about other aspects of the risk factor assessment.
For example: Prevalence of the risk factor in family members.
The risk factor has been identified as present, but then subsequently been mitigated by treatment or investigation.

Record as True if the risk factor has been treated or investigated and risk from this risk factor is considered to be lessened. For example: an infant given gentamicin in neonatal intensive care is regarded as having a risk of permanent hearing loss. If diagnostic testing shows no evidence of hearing loss in the first year of life, the risk of later hearing loss is considered to be much reduced, but still possible. This data element allows clinicians to say that the risk has been mitigated but should still be considered as a possibility in future. In practice, the risk factor could be maintained in the risk assessment in case it might impact the individual's health at a future time, but flagging that its contribution to risk calculation may not be as great as if it had not been previously treated or investigated.
The date/time that the risk factor was identified.
Additional narrative about the risk factor not captured in other fields.
The patient is in a house with other household members who are ill
Members of the patient's household have travel exposure.
Evaluacion de riesgo para la salud
Evaluación del potencial y probabilidad de futuros efectos adversos para la salud determinados por la identificación de factores de riesgo.
Identificación, por nombre, de la enfermedad, condición o problema de salud potenciales para el cual se evalua el riesgo.

Se prefiere la codificación del 'Riesgo para la salud' mediante una terminología cuando esto sea posible. El texto libre solo debería ser utilizado cuando no se disponga de una terminología adecuada. Por ejemplo: riesgo de enfermedad cardiovascular con factores de riesgo de hipertensión arterial e hipercolesterolemia.
Identificación, por nombre, del factor de riesgo.

Por ejemplo: hipertensión arterial e hipercolesterolemia, que pueden ser utilizados como parte de una evaluación general de enfermedad cardiovascular; o un marcador genético. Codificar el factor de riesgo mediante una terminología cuando esto sea posible.
*Contact with suspected case/ pneumonia case within 14 days before symptom onset. (en)
*Contact with birds in China in 10 days before symptom onset. (en)
*Contact with confirmed human case of Avian flu in China (en)
*Contact with confirmed human case of Avian flu in China in 10 days before symptom onset. (en)
*Contact with severe, unexplained respiratory disease in 10 days before symptom onset. (en)
Detalle estructurado acerca de otros aspectos de la evaluación del factor de riesgo.
Por ejemplo: Prevalencia del factor de riesgo en famililares.
*No information is available for this risk factor. (en)
Evaluación del riesgo para la salud.

Pueden haber múltiples variaciones en la evaluación de riesgo. La elección del tipo de dato permite el registro de la evaluación tanto mediante texto libre como mediante un conjunto de valores (tales como bajo, medio o alto). El tipo de dato 'proporción' permite el registro como un porcentaje, una tasa o una fracción. El tipo de dato 'cantidad' permite el registro como un número decimal.
*Covid19 infection is assessed to be low-risk (en)
*The risk of the a patient having a Covid-19 infection is assessed to be high. (en)
*Does the patient require hospital admission with either clinical or radiological evidence of pneumonia, adult respiratory distress syndrome, or influenza like illness? (en)
Evaluacion de riesgo para la salud
Evaluación del potencial y probabilidad de futuros efectos adversos para la salud determinados por la identificación de factores de riesgo.
Identificación, por nombre, de la enfermedad, condición o problema de salud potenciales para el cual se evalua el riesgo.

Se prefiere la codificación del 'Riesgo para la salud' mediante una terminología cuando esto sea posible. El texto libre solo debería ser utilizado cuando no se disponga de una terminología adecuada. Por ejemplo: riesgo de enfermedad cardiovascular con factores de riesgo de hipertensión arterial e hipercolesterolemia.
Evaluación del riesgo para la salud.

Pueden haber múltiples variaciones en la evaluación de riesgo. La elección del tipo de dato permite el registro de la evaluación tanto mediante texto libre como mediante un conjunto de valores (tales como bajo, medio o alto). El tipo de dato 'proporción' permite el registro como un porcentaje, una tasa o una fracción. El tipo de dato 'cantidad' permite el registro como un número decimal.
Justificación para esta evaluación de riesgo.
Detalles que pueden ser agregados en este elemento pueden incluir información acerca de la población, subgrupos, etc, frente a los cuales se evalúa el riesgo.
Información adicional requerida para registrar contenido local o para alinear con otros modelos o formalismos de referencia.
Por ejemplo: requerimientos locales de información o metadatos adicionales para alinear con equivalentes FHIR o CIMI.
Identificación del path al arquetipo o nodo de datos que contiene la evidencia del riesgo.
Identificación, por nombre, del factor de riesgo.

Por ejemplo: hipertensión arterial e hipercolesterolemia, que pueden ser utilizados como parte de una evaluación general de enfermedad cardiovascular; o un marcador genético. Codificar el factor de riesgo mediante una terminología cuando esto sea posible.
Descripción narrativa del factor de riesgo.
Narrativa adicional acerca de la evaluación de riesgo no contemplada en otros campos.
Detalles acerca de cada factor de riesgo posible.
El factor de riesgo ha sido identificado para este individuo.
El factor de riesgo no ha sido identificado para este individuo.
Registro acerca de la condición relativa o absoluta de la evaluación del riesgo.
Probabilidad de la ocurrencia de un evento o condición de salud en comparación con una población de características similares. Ejemplo: mismo sexo y edad.
Probabilidad de la ocurrencia de un evento o condición de salud en comparación con el total de la población.
El período de tiempo durante el cual el riesgo para la salud previsto es relevante.
Esto es: el riesgo de incurrir en el 'riesgo para la salud' identificado, en el curso de los próximos <X> años.
La fecha en la cual se realizó la ultima actualización de este factor de riesgo para la salud.

*This data element may be thought redundant if the data is recorded and stored using COMPOSITIONs within a closed clinical system. However if this information is extracted from its original COMPOSITION context, for example, to be included in another document or message then the temporal context is effectively removed. This 'Last updated' data element has been explicitly added to allow the critical temporal data to be kept alongside the clinical data in all circumstances. It is assumed that the clinical system can copy the date from the COMPOSITION to reduce the need for duplication of data entry by the clinician. (en)
Identificación del algoritmo o de la guia utilziada para realizar la evaluación de riesgo.
Por ejemplo: el cálculo de riesgo cardiovascular de Framingham.
No es posible determinar la presencia o ausencia del factor de riesgo.
Detalle estructurado acerca de otros aspectos de la evaluación del factor de riesgo.
Por ejemplo: Prevalencia del factor de riesgo en famililares.
El factor de riesgo esta presente pero ha sido subsecuentemente mitigado por tratamiento o investigación.

Registrar como Verdadero si el factor de riesgo ha sido tratado o mejor investigado como para determinar que el riesgo puede considerarse disminuido. Por ejemplo: un niño ha recibido gentamicina en la unidad de cuidados intensivos neonatales puede considerarse en riesgo para hipoacusia permanente. Si los estudios diagnósticos no muestran evidencia de hipoacusia en el primer año de vida, el riesgo de hipoacusia posterior pueden considerarse como muy disminuido pero aún posible. Este dato permite a los clínicos considerar que el riesgo ha sido mitigado pero debe aún ser considerado como una posibildiad futura. En la práctica, el factor de riesgo puede mantenerse para la evaluación de riesgo en caso de poder tener impacto futuro sobre la salud del individuo, pero señalando que su contribución a la determinación del riesgo puede no ser tan importante como si no hubiera sido tratado o investigado.
*The date/time that the risk factor was identified.(en)
*Additional narrative about the risk factor not captured in other fields.(en)
*The patient is in a house with other household members who are ill (en)
*Members of the patient's household have travel exposure. (en)
Bedömning av potential och sannolikhet för framtida negativa hälsoeffekter som bestäms av identifierade riskfaktorer.
Identifiering med namn av den potentiella framtida sjukdomen, tillståndet eller hälsotillståndet för vilken risken är bedömd.

Vid kodning av "Risk" med en terminologi är att föredra, om möjligt. Fri text ska endast användas om det inte finns någon lämplig terminologi. Till exempel: risk för kardiovaskulär sjukdom, med riskfaktorer för hypertension och hyperkolesterolemi.

Till exempel: högt blodtryck och hyperkolesterolemi, som kan användas som en del av den övergripande bedömningen för kardiovaskulär sjukdom; eller en genetisk markör. Vid kodning av Riskfaktor använd en terminologi om det är möjligt.
*Contact with suspected case/ pneumonia case within 14 days before symptom onset. (en)
*Contact with birds in China in 10 days before symptom onset. (en)
*Contact with confirmed human case of Avian flu in China (en)
*Contact with confirmed human case of Avian flu in China in 10 days before symptom onset. (en)
*Contact with severe, unexplained respiratory disease in 10 days before symptom onset. (en)
Strukturerad detalj om andra aspekter av riskfaktorbedömningen.
Till exempel: Förekomst av riskfaktorn hos familjemedlemmar.
*No information is available for this risk factor. (en)

Det kan finnas flera variationer i riskbedömningen. Datatypen val (choice) möjliggör registrering av bedömningen som antingen fritext eller vallista (t.ex. låg, medium eller hög). Datatypen andel (proportion) tillåter registrering av en procentandel, ett förhållande eller en fraktion. Datatypen numerisk (quantity) tillåter registrering av ett decimaltal.
*Covid19 infection is assessed to be low-risk (en)
*The risk of the a patient having a Covid-19 infection is assessed to be high. (en)
*Does the patient require hospital admission with either clinical or radiological evidence of pneumonia, adult respiratory distress syndrome, or influenza like illness? (en)
Bedömning av potential och sannolikhet för framtida negativa hälsoeffekter som bestäms av identifierade riskfaktorer.
Identifiering med namn av den potentiella framtida sjukdomen, tillståndet eller hälsotillståndet för vilken risken är bedömd.

Vid kodning av "Risk" med en terminologi är att föredra, om möjligt. Fri text ska endast användas om det inte finns någon lämplig terminologi. Till exempel: risk för kardiovaskulär sjukdom, med riskfaktorer för hypertension och hyperkolesterolemi.

Det kan finnas flera variationer i riskbedömningen. Datatypen val (choice) möjliggör registrering av bedömningen som antingen fritext eller vallista (t.ex. låg, medium eller hög). Datatypen andel (proportion) tillåter registrering av en procentandel, ett förhållande eller en fraktion. Datatypen numerisk (quantity) tillåter registrering av ett decimaltal.
Detaljer som kan läggas till i detta dataelement kan innehålla information om befolkningsundergrupperna etc mot vilka bestämningen av risken bedöms.
Ytterligare information som krävs för att fånga upp lokalt innehåll eller för anpassning sig till andra referensmodeller / formaliteter.
Till exempel: lokala informationskrav eller ytterligare metadata för att anpassa sig till FHIR- eller CIMI-ekvivalenter.
Identifiering av sökvägen till arketypen eller datanoden för evidensen för risk.

Till exempel: högt blodtryck och hyperkolesterolemi, som kan användas som en del av den övergripande bedömningen för kardiovaskulär sjukdom; eller en genetisk markör. Vid kodning av Riskfaktor använd en terminologi om det är möjligt.
Ytterligare beskrivning om riskbedömningen som inte tagits med i andra fält.
Riskfaktorn har identifierats för den här personen.
Riskfaktorn har inte identifierats för den här personen.
Uppgift om riskbedömningen är relativ eller absolut.
Förhållande mellan sannolikheten för ett hälsohändelse eller ett tillstånd som uppstår jämfört med en befolkning med liknande egenskaper, t.ex. samma ålder och kön.
Förhållandet mellan sannolikheten för en hälsohändelse eller ett tillstånd som uppstår i förhållande till befolkningen som helhet.
Den tidsperiod under vilken den förutspådda hälsorisken är relevant.
Det vill säga: risken att drabbas av den identifierade hälsorisken under de kommande <X> åren.

*This data element may be thought redundant if the data is recorded and stored using COMPOSITIONs within a closed clinical system. However if this information is extracted from its original COMPOSITION context, for example, to be included in another document or message then the temporal context is effectively removed. This 'Last updated' data element has been explicitly added to allow the critical temporal data to be kept alongside the clinical data in all circumstances. It is assumed that the clinical system can copy the date from the COMPOSITION to reduce the need for duplication of data entry by the clinician. (en)
Identifiering av metoden eller riktlinjen som används för bedömning av risker.
Det är inte möjligt att bestämma om riskfaktorn finns eller är frånvarande.
Strukturerad detalj om andra aspekter av riskfaktorbedömningen.
Till exempel: Förekomst av riskfaktorn hos familjemedlemmar.
Riskfaktorn har identifierats att den finns, men har därefter minskats genom behandling eller undersökning.

Anteckna som sant om riskfaktorn har behandlats eller undersökts och risken från denna riskfaktor anses vara nedsatt. Till exempel: ett barn som ges gentamicin i neonatal intensivvård anses ha risk för permanent hörselnedsättning. Om diagnostisk testning inte visar någon hörselnedsättning under det första levnadsåret, anses risken för senare hörselnedsättning vara mycket reducerad men fortfarande möjlig. Detta dataelement gör det möjligt för kliniker att säga att risken har minskats men ska betraktas som en möjlighet i framtiden. I praktiken kan riskfaktorn bibehållas i riskbedömningen om det kan påverka den enskilda människans hälsa i framtiden, men att det inte är så stort att dess bidrag till riskberäkning är lika stort som om det inte tidigare har behandlats eller undersökts.
Ytterligare beskrivning av riskfaktorn som inte fångats i andra fält.
*The patient is in a house with other household members who are ill (en)
*Members of the patient's household have travel exposure. (en)
Vurdering av potensiale og sannsynlighet for fremtidige uønskede helseeffekter, bestemt ut fra spesifikke risikofaktorer.
Navnet på den potensielle fremtidige sykdommen, tilstanden eller helseproblemet som risikoen gjelder.

*Coding of 'Health risk' with a terminology is preferred, where possible. Free text should be used only if there is no appropriate terminology available. For example: risk of cardiovascular disease, with risk factors of hypertension and hypercholesterolaemia. (en)
Assessment of risk of COVID-19 infection

*For example: hypertension and hypercholesterolaemia, which may be used as part of the overall assessment for cardiovascular disease; or a genetic marker. Coding of 'Risk factor' with a terminology, where possible. (en)
Contact with confirmed Covid-19 case within 14 days before symptom onset.
Contact with suspected case/ pneumonia case
Contact with suspected case/ pneumonia case within 14 days before symptom onset.
Contact with birds in China in 10 days before symptom onset.
Contact with confirmed human case of Avian flu in China
Contact with confirmed human case of Avian flu in China in 10 days before symptom onset.
Contact with severe, unexplained respiratory disease
Contact with severe, unexplained respiratory disease in 10 days before symptom onset.
Potential contact exposure based on location
Potential contact exposure based on location
Structured detail about other aspects of the risk factor assessment.
For example: Prevalence of the risk factor in family members.
*No information is available for this risk factor. (en)

There may be multiple variations on the assessment of risk. The Choice data type allows for recording of the assessment as either free text or value sets (such as low, medium or hig). The proportion data type allows recording of a percentage, a ratio or a fraction. The quantity data type allows recording of a decimal number.
*Covid19 infection is assessed to be low-risk (en)
*The risk of the a patient having a Covid-19 infection is assessed to be high. (en)
*Does the patient require hospital admission with either clinical or radiological evidence of pneumonia, adult respiratory distress syndrome, or influenza like illness? (en)
Assessment of the potential and likelihood of future adverse health effects as determined by identified risk factors.
Identification of the potential future disease, condition or health issue for which the risk is being assessed, by name.

Coding of 'Health risk' with a terminology is preferred, where possible. Free text should be used only if there is no appropriate terminology available. For example: risk of cardiovascular disease, with risk factors of hypertension and hypercholesterolaemia.

There may be multiple variations on the assessment of risk. The Choice data type allows for recording of the assessment as either free text or value sets (such as low, medium or hig). The proportion data type allows recording of a percentage, a ratio or a fraction. The quantity data type allows recording of a decimal number.
Details that may be added to this data element may include information about the population subgroups etc against which the determination of risk is assessed.
Additional information required to capture local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms.
For example: local information requirements or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.
Identification of the path to the archetype or data node for the evidence of risk.
Identification of the risk factor, by name.

For example: hypertension and hypercholesterolaemia, which may be used as part of the overall assessment for cardiovascular disease; or a genetic marker. Coding of 'Risk factor' with a terminology, where possible.
Narrative description about the risk factor.
Additional narrative about the risk assessment not captured in other fields.
Details about each possible risk factor.
The risk factor has been identified for this individual.
The risk factor has not been identified for this individual.
Record of whether the risk assessment is a relative or absolute.
Ratio of probability of a health event or condition occurring compared to a population with similar characteristics eg same age and sex.
Ratio of probability of a health event or condition occurring compared to the population as a whole.
The time period during which the predicted health risk is relevant.
That is: the risk of experiencing the identified 'Health risk' in the next <X> years.
The date this health risk assessment was last updated.

This data element may be thought redundant if the data is recorded and stored using COMPOSITIONs within a closed clinical system. However if this information is extracted from its original COMPOSITION context, for example, to be included in another document or message then the temporal context is effectively removed. This 'Last updated' data element has been explicitly added to allow the critical temporal data to be kept alongside the clinical data in all circumstances. It is assumed that the clinical system can copy the date from the COMPOSITION to reduce the need for duplication of data entry by the clinician.
Identification of the algorithm or guideline used to make the assessment of risk.
For example: Framingham cardiovascular risk calculator.
It is not possible to determine if the risk factor is present or absent.
Structured detail about other aspects of the risk factor assessment.
For example: Prevalence of the risk factor in family members.
The risk factor has been identified as present, but then subsequently been mitigated by treatment or investigation.

Record as True if the risk factor has been treated or investigated and risk from this risk factor is considered to be lessened. For example: an infant given gentamicin in neonatal intensive care is regarded as having a risk of permanent hearing loss. If diagnostic testing shows no evidence of hearing loss in the first year of life, the risk of later hearing loss is considered to be much reduced, but still possible. This data element allows clinicians to say that the risk has been mitigated but should still be considered as a possibility in future. In practice, the risk factor could be maintained in the risk assessment in case it might impact the individual's health at a future time, but flagging that its contribution to risk calculation may not be as great as if it had not been previously treated or investigated.
The date/time that the risk factor was identified.
Additional narrative about the risk factor not captured in other fields.
*The patient is in a house with other household members who are ill (en)
*Members of the patient's household have travel exposure. (en)
Arvio Covid-19-tartunnan potentiaalista ja todennäköisyydestä tunnistettujen riskitekijöiden perusteella.
* Mahdollisen tulevan sairauden, tilan tai terveysongelman, josta riskiä arvioidaan, yksilöinti nimellä.

Kontakti todetun Covid-19 tartunnan saaneen kanssa
Yhteys vahvistettuun Covid-19-tapaukseen 14 päivän kuluessa ennen oireen puhkeamista.
Yhteys epäiltyyn / keuhkokuumetapaukseen 14 päivän kuluessa ennen oireen puhkeamista.
Kosketus lintuihin Kiinassa 10 päivässä ennen oireiden puhkeamista.
Yhteys vahvistettuun lintuinfluenssatapaukseen Kiinassa 10 päivän kuluessa ennen oireiden puhkeamista.
Kosketus vakavaan, selittämättömään hengitystiesairauteen 10 päivässä ennen oireiden puhkeamista.
Jäsennelty yksityiskohta muista riskitekijöiden arvioinnin näkökohdista.

Potilaan riski saada Covid-19-infektio on vähäinen.
Potilaan riski saada Covid-19-infektio on suuri.

*Record as True if the risk factor has been treated or investigated and risk from this risk factor is considered to be lessened. For example: an infant given gentamicin in neonatal intensive care is regarded as having a risk of permanent hearing loss. If diagnostic testing shows no evidence of hearing loss in the first year of life, the risk of later hearing loss is considered to be much reduced, but still possible. This data element allows clinicians to say that the risk has been mitigated but should still be considered as a possibility in future. In practice, the risk factor could be maintained in the risk assessment in case it might impact the individual's health at a future time, but flagging that its contribution to risk calculation may not be as great as if it had not been previously treated or investigated. Valutazione del rischio potenziale e della probabilità di infezione da COVID-19 e di futuri effetti indesiderati sulla salute, così come determinato dai fattori di rischio identificati
Identificazione della potenziale futura malattia, condizione o problema sanitario per il quale si sta valutando il rischio, per nome

E' preferibile identificare il "rischio clinico" tramite una terminologia, ove possibile. Il testo libero dovrebbe essere utilizzato esclusivamente nei casi in cui non fosse disponibile una terminologia appropriata. Per esempio: rischio di malattie cardiovascolari, con fattori di rischio di ipertensione ed ipercolesterolemia.
Identificazione del fattore di rischio, per nome

Per esempio: ipertensione ed ipercolesterolemia, che possono essere usate come parte della valutazione globale per le malattie cardiovascolari; oppure un marker genetico. Codificare, ove possibile, il "Fattore di rischio" tramite l'utilizzo di una terminologia.
Contatto con un caso confermato di COVID-19
Contatto con un caso confermato di COVID-19 entro i 14 giorni prima dell'insorgenza dei sintomi.
Contatto con un caso sospetto/caso di polmonite
Contatto con un caso sospetto/caso di polmonite entro i 14 giorni prima dell'insorgenza dei sintomi.
Contatto con volatili in Cina entro i 10 giorni prima dell'insorgenza dei sintomi.
Contatto, relativo ad una persona, con un caso confermato di influenza aviaria in Cina
Contatto, relativo ad una persona, con un caso confermato di influenza aviaria entro i 10 giorni prima dell'insorgenza dei sintomi.
Contatto con gravi ed inspiegabili problemi respiratori
Contatto con gravi ed inspiegabili problemi respiratori entro i 10 giorni prima dell'insorgenza dei sintomi.
Esposizione ad un potenziale contatto, dovuta al luogo
Esposizione ad un potenziale contatto, dovuta al luogo
Dettaglio strutturato su altri aspetti riguardanti la valutazione del rischio
Per esempio: diffusione del fattore di rischio tra i membri della famiglia.
Nessuna informazione sul fattore di rischio è tuttora disponibile.

Ci possono essere molteplici cambiamenti nella valutazione del rischio. Il data type Choice permette di codificare la valutazione sia come testo libero sia come set di valori (quali basso, medio o alto). Il data type Proportion permette di indicare una percentuale, un rapporto o una frazione. Il data type Quantity permette di indicare un numero decimale.
Il rischio che il paziente sia affetto da COVID-19 è stato valutato basso.
Il rischio che il paziente sia affetto da COVID-19 è stato valutato alto.
Assessment of the potential and likelihood of future adverse health effects as determined by identified risk factors.
Identification of the potential future disease, condition or health issue for which the risk is being assessed, by name.

Coding of 'Health risk' with a terminology is preferred, where possible. Free text should be used only if there is no appropriate terminology available. For example: risk of cardiovascular disease, with risk factors of hypertension and hypercholesterolaemia.

The proportion data type allows recording of a percentage, a ratio or a fraction. The quantity data type allows recording of a decimal number.

The date this health risk assessment was last updated.

Record as True if the risk factor has been treated or investigated and risk from this risk factor is considered to be lessened. For example: an infant given gentamicin in neonatal intensive care is regarded as having a risk of permanent hearing loss. If diagnostic testing shows no evidence of hearing loss in the first year of life, the risk of later hearing loss is considered to be much reduced, but still possible. This data element allows clinicians to say that the risk has been mitigated but should still be considered as a possibility in future. In practice, the risk factor could be maintained in the risk assessment in case it might impact the individual's health at a future time, but flagging that its contribution to risk calculation may not be as great as if it had not been previously treated or investigated.
